title: Introducing: WHATEVER, DAD
content:
Now, this is pretty special.

With numerous big budget, high profile releases so far this year, it speaks volumes that this debut EP from New York’s WHATEVER, DAD blows all of them out of the water. The solo project of 18 year old ‘E L A I Z A‘, her recent six track outing is quite possibly the most appealing, immersing new music you’ll hear this year. Forgive me if I’m waffling slightly, but I’m truly that excited.

From scouring E L A I Z A’s Audioboo account and various blogs, it’s clear that she has a healthy/unhealthy obsession with many of the greats; Jeff Mangum, Talking Heads and Vera Lynn amongst other, alongside a completely unique (some might read pretentious, not me) vision of the world around her. It’s these quirky characteristics and stellar influences that have shaped her music, chiseling her self-titled release into a deeply personal yet engaging listen. The likes of B U B B L E G U M S H R I N E and W A R S H are entirely acoustic numbers, relying on E L A I Z A’s 1960’s styled vocals and and intelligent lyricism.

Whilst I’m wary of drawing this comparison, there’s an element of Lana Del Rey amongst the refined vocals, yet the unpolished instrumentation is a startling contrast, ultimately coming across far more like Charlotte Gainsbourg than the pouty lipped popstar. In the latter half of the release, the tracks gain a Neutral Milk Hotel-esque confidence, most notably on my personal favourite ✩☀♡ séquence de rêve ♡☀✩ coupled with sublime lyricism – ‘holding her pachyderms, memories, bled back to me, books from a previous, dream warned violent’. A P P L E P E E L S, sung entirely in French wouldn’t seem out of place in a 1960’s Parisian romantic thriller and closer R E S T S T O P, coincidentally almost twice the length of any other track is an ode to the real woman, scorning the futile and fickle tendencies of others. I can guarantee now that WHATEVER, DAD will not be to everyone’s taste, however that’s not going to stop me falling head over heels.

Check out a couple of my favourites and grab a free download of the full release from WHATEVER, DAD’s bandcamp.
